sites.name: Van Abbemuseum
sites.description: The Van Abbemuseum is one of Europe's leading museums for modern and contemporary art. Founded in 1936, it houses an extensive collection including works by Picasso, Chagall, Kandinsky, and Mondrian. The museum's striking modern building, designed by Abel Cahen, features innovative exhibition spaces and a distinctive glass facade. The collection focuses on modern art movements and contemporary artists, with special attention to Dutch and international avant-garde movements.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with climate-controlled galleries. Special exhibitions rotate throughout the year. Summer brings outdoor installations and events. Museum closed on Mondays except during holidays. Extended hours on Thursday evenings with special programming.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended for special exhibitions. Museum card accepted. Guided tours available in multiple languages. Located in city center near train station. Café on premises with outdoor seating in summer.

sites.name: Philips Museum
sites.description: The Philips Museum tells the story of how a small light bulb factory grew into one of the world's largest technology companies. Located in the original Philips factory building from 1891, the museum showcases the company's history through interactive exhibits, historic products, and multimedia presentations. Visitors can explore the evolution of technology from the first light bulbs to modern healthcare innovations.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round except Mondays. Special exhibitions highlight different aspects of Philips history. School holidays bring family-oriented programming. Museum closed on major holidays. Extended hours during special events.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended. Guided tours available for groups. Located in city center near train station. Museum shop offers Philips-branded souvenirs. Café on premises.

sites.name: Eindhoven Design District
sites.description: The Eindhoven Design District is a vibrant area showcasing the city's creative spirit through design studios, galleries, and innovative architecture. The district includes the Strijp-S area, a former Philips industrial complex transformed into a creative hub. Visitors can explore design shops, art galleries, and creative workspaces while experiencing the city's modern architectural transformation.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round. Dutch Design Week in October brings special events and exhibitions. Summer brings outdoor markets and events. Winter features light installations and holiday markets. Regular design markets throughout the year.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general exploration. Guided tours available for design district. Many shops closed on Sundays. Located near city center, accessible by foot or bicycle. Multiple cafés and restaurants in area.

sites.name: PSV Museum
sites.description: The PSV Museum celebrates the history of PSV Eindhoven, one of the Netherlands' most successful football clubs. Located in the Philips Stadium, the museum features trophies, memorabilia, and interactive exhibits about the club's history. Visitors can explore the stadium, see the team's achievements, and learn about famous players who have represented the club.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round except match days. Special exhibitions during major tournaments. Closed during major holidays. Stadium tours available on non-match days. Extended hours during special events.
sites.booking_tips: Advance booking recommended for stadium tours. Museum entry included with stadium tour. Located near city center, accessible by public transport. Shop offers PSV merchandise. Café on premises.

sites.name: Daf Museum
sites.description: The DAF Museum tells the story of the Dutch truck and car manufacturer DAF, showcasing its history from the 1920s to the present. The museum features historic vehicles, interactive exhibits about automotive technology, and displays about DAF's innovations in truck manufacturing. Visitors can see classic cars, trucks, and learn about the company's engineering achievements.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round except Mondays. Special exhibitions focus on different aspects of DAF history. School holidays bring family programming. Closed on major holidays. Extended hours during special events.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended. Guided tours available for groups. Located near city center. Museum shop offers DAF merchandise. Café on premises.

sites.name: Genneper Parken
sites.description: Genneper Parken is a large recreational area combining nature, sports facilities, and cultural attractions. The park includes walking and cycling trails, sports fields, and the Genneper Watermill. The area features diverse landscapes including forests, meadows, and water features, making it a popular destination for outdoor activities and relaxation.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round. Spring brings flowering plants and new growth. Summer offers outdoor activities and events. Autumn features colorful foliage. Winter brings opportunities for ice skating when conditions allow. Regular events throughout the year.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general access. Some facilities require advance booking. Located south of city center, accessible by bicycle or public transport. Multiple cafés and restaurants in area.

sites.name: Dutch Design Week
sites.description: Dutch Design Week is the largest design event in Northern Europe, held annually in Eindhoven. For nine days in October, the city transforms into a showcase for Dutch design talent, featuring exhibitions, workshops, lectures, and events throughout the city. The event attracts designers, architects, and creative professionals from around the world.
sites.seasonal_notes: Held annually in October. Multiple venues throughout the city. Indoor and outdoor events. Special programming for professionals and public. Extended hours during festival period.
sites.booking_tips: Advance tickets recommended for popular events. Festival pass available for full access. Many events require separate booking. Located throughout city center and design district. Special shuttle service during event.

sites.name: St. Catherine's Church
sites.description: St. Catherine's Church is a historic Catholic church in the heart of Eindhoven. Built in the 19th century, the church features neo-Gothic architecture and impressive stained glass windows. The church serves as both a place of worship and a cultural landmark, hosting regular services and occasional concerts.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round for services and visits. Special services during holidays. Regular organ concerts. Closed during private events. Extended hours during special occasions.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general visits. Guided tours available by appointment. Located in city center. Photography permitted except during services. Donations appreciated.

sites.name: Eindhoven Museum
sites.description: The Eindhoven Museum is an open-air museum that brings history to life through reconstructed buildings and historical demonstrations. The museum focuses on the Iron Age and Middle Ages, offering visitors the chance to experience life in these periods through interactive exhibits and living history demonstrations.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open March through October. Special events during school holidays. Demonstrations and workshops scheduled throughout season. Closed during winter months. Extended hours during special events.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended. Guided tours available. Located in Genneper Parken. Demonstrations scheduled on weekends. Café on premises.

sites.name: Kazerne
sites.description: Kazerne is a creative hub and cultural venue located in a former military barracks. The space hosts exhibitions, design events, and cultural programming throughout the year. The venue combines historical architecture with contemporary design, serving as a platform for emerging artists and designers.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round except Mondays. Regular exhibitions and events. Special programming during Dutch Design Week. Extended hours during special events. Closed on major holidays.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general visits. Special events may require tickets. Located in city center. Café on premises. Regular guided tours available.

sites.name: Evoluon
sites.description: The Evoluon is a distinctive flying-saucer-shaped building that originally opened as a science museum in 1966 by Philips. After several years as a conference center, it has been renovated and reopened as an innovation and technology experience center. The building itself is an architectural landmark of Eindhoven, with its futuristic design representing the city's focus on innovation.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Special exhibitions and technology showcases rotate throughout the year. Evening events and light shows during winter months. Extended hours during Dutch Design Week.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended. Group discounts available. Located slightly outside city center, accessible by public transport. Café on premises with panoramic views. Gift shop sells technology and design-focused merchandise.

sites.name: Piet Hein Eek Factory
sites.description: The Piet Hein Eek Factory is a creative complex established by renowned Dutch designer Piet Hein Eek. Located in a former Philips factory in the Strijp-R area, the space combines a design studio, showroom, gallery, restaurant, and shop. Visitors can watch artisans at work, explore sustainable design concepts, and see how discarded materials are transformed into high-end furniture and objects.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round except Sundays and Mondays. Studio tours available on weekdays. Special events during Dutch Design Week. Restaurant opens for lunch and dinner. Shop hours extended on Saturdays.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for showroom visits. Reservations recommended for restaurant. Studio tours require advance booking. Located in Strijp-R area, accessible by bicycle or public transport. On-site parking available.

sites.name: Blob
sites.description: The Blob is a distinctive blob-shaped building designed by Italian architect Massimiliano Fuksas and completed in 2010. Located in the heart of Eindhoven's shopping district, the futuristic structure houses retail spaces and has become an iconic part of the city's urban landscape. Its unusual organic form and translucent skin create a striking contrast to the surrounding traditional architecture.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round during retail hours. Exterior illuminated at night, creating a dramatic visual in the city center. Special lighting displays during GLOW Festival. Extended hours during shopping events and holidays.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Located in city center shopping district. Surrounded by cafés and restaurants. Photography permitted of exterior and public spaces. Best viewed from 18 Septemberplein.

sites.name: PreHistorisch Dorp
sites.description: PreHistorisch Dorp (Prehistoric Village) is an open-air archaeological museum that recreates prehistoric and early historic settlements. Visitors can experience daily life from the Stone Age through the Middle Ages through reconstructed buildings, demonstrations of ancient crafts, and interactive activities. Historical interpreters in period costume demonstrate techniques such as fire-making, blacksmithing, pottery, and cooking.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open March through October. Summer features full demonstration schedule and hands-on activities. Special events during school holidays. Historical festivals with reenactments held seasonally. Reduced programming during winter months.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended. Family passes available. Located in Genneper Parken. Educational programs for school groups. Café serves historical-inspired meals. Gift shop sells handcrafted replicas.

sites.name: GLOW Eindhoven
sites.description: GLOW Eindhoven is an annual light art festival that transforms the city into an open-air gallery of illuminated artworks and installations. For one week in November, international artists create light-based artworks that interact with the city's architecture and public spaces. The walking route takes visitors through the city center and cultural districts, highlighting both historic and contemporary aspects of Eindhoven.
sites.seasonal_notes: Held annually in November. All installations illuminated from 18:30 to 23:00. Special opening ceremony first evening. Additional indoor exhibitions and events throughout festival period. Workshops and talks during daytime hours.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general access. Guided tours available with advance booking. Located throughout city center with marked walking route. Food stalls along route. Public transport extended during festival evenings. App available with installation information.

sites.name: NatLab
sites.description: NatLab is a cultural center housed in the former Philips Physics Laboratory. The space now combines cinema, theater, and exhibition spaces with a focus on the intersection of art, science, and technology. The complex preserves elements of its industrial heritage while providing a platform for contemporary cultural programming.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Film festivals throughout the year. Theater season runs September through May. Summer features outdoor screenings and performances. Extended hours during special events and festivals.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended for films and performances. Membership offers discounts. Located in Strijp-S area. Restaurant on premises serving lunch and dinner. Exhibitions generally free to enter.

sites.name: Het Veem
sites.description: Het Veem is a creative workspace and cultural hub located in a former industrial building in the Strijp-S district. The complex houses design studios, creative businesses, exhibition spaces, and event venues. The building maintains its industrial character while providing a platform for emerging talent in design, technology, and creative industries.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round during weekdays and Saturdays. Special exhibitions during Dutch Design Week. Regular design markets and events. Summer brings outdoor activities and food festivals. Extended hours during special events.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general visits. Special events may require tickets. Located in Strijp-S area. Café on premises. Accessible by public transport. Regular guided tours available.

sites.name: Inkijkmuseum
sites.description: The Inkijkmuseum (Look-In Museum) is a unique micro-museum located in a former shop. Rather than entering the space, visitors look through the windows to see changing art installations and miniature exhibitions. The concept challenges traditional museum formats and brings art into public space, allowing visitors to experience curated displays at any time of day.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round, 24 hours a day. Exhibitions change monthly. Special installations during Dutch Design Week and GLOW Festival. Winter features light-based installations. Summer showcases emerging artists.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Viewable from street at any time. Located in Dommelstraat. Information available via QR code on window. Close to city center restaurants and cafés.

sites.name: MU Artspace
sites.description: MU Artspace is a contemporary art institution that focuses on emerging talent and interdisciplinary projects. Located in the Strijp-S area, the gallery presents exhibitions that explore the boundaries between art, design, technology, and society. With a focus on current developments and experimental approaches, MU provides a platform for innovative artistic practices.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round except Mondays. Exhibitions change quarterly. Special programming during Dutch Design Week. Artist talks and workshops scheduled throughout the year. Extended hours during exhibition openings.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general visits. Workshops require advance booking. Located in Strijp-S area. Gallery staff provide information about exhibitions. Public guided tours on weekend afternoons.

sites.name: Radio Royaal
sites.description: Radio Royaal is a restaurant located in a former radio factory in the Strijp-S district. The industrial space has been transformed into a unique dining venue that preserves much of the original factory character. The high ceilings, large windows, and historic machinery create a distinctive atmosphere that connects to Eindhoven's industrial heritage.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round for dinner, lunch service Thursday to Sunday. Seasonal menu changes quarterly. Special events during Dutch Design Week. Summer features outdoor seating. Live music on selected evenings.
sites.booking_tips: Reservations recommended, especially for evenings and weekends. Located in Strijp-S area. Accessible by public transport. Private dining available for groups. Bar area available without reservation.
